numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I looked closely at the graph.
2. If a person is rich and the family of the person attended the school, then the person has a very high chance of admission.
3. If a person is rich and the family of the person did not attend the school, then the person still has a chance of admission.
4. If a person is not rich and the family of the person attended the school, then the person has a chance of admission.
5. If a person is not rich and the family of the person did not attend the school, then the person has almost no chance of admission.
6. I wonder if the situation would be different.
7. I wonder if the situation would be different if the school stops using parental income in the admission decision.
9. Many people in my town attended Ivy League schools.
10. This information is not new to me.
11. Many students in my town are pushed to apply to Ivy League schools.
12. The parents of these students attended Ivy League schools.
13. The headline is: No money? No admittance.
